AccessControlBadConfirmation().details: The caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}.

ECDSAInvalidSignatureLength(uint256).details: The signature has an invalid length.

ECDSAInvalidSignatureS(bytes32).details: The signature has an S value that is in the upper half order.

params.amount: - The address that receives the profit for the referral system.
params.recipient: - The address that receives the profit for the referral system.

params.user: - The user who made the deposit.

EIP712DomainChanged().details: MAY be emitted to signal that the domain could have changed.

RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32.details: Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted signaling this.

RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}.

RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)

params.user: - User where the deposit was withdrawn.

addFunds().details: Can only be used by the operator role.

params.claimParams: - Object with information about the output profit.

deposit().details: The ETH sent must be greater than zero.

deposit(address).details: The ETH sent must be greater than zero.

params.recipient: - The address to which the deposit is to be credited.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

removeFunds(address,uint256).details: Can only be used by the operator role.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

withdraw(address,address,uint256,uint256.details: Can only be used by the operator role.

params.from: - Address from which to withdraw deposit.
params.to: - Address where to send the deposit.

withdrawBatch(address[],address[],uint25.details: Can only be used by the operator role.

params.from: - Addresses from which to withdraw deposit.
params.to: - Addresses where to send the deposits.

Claimed(address,uint256).notice: Emitted when a user comes for profit from the referral system.

Deposit(address,uint256).notice: Emitted when a user makes a deposit.

Withdrawal(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Emitted when a user withdraws a deposit.

addFunds().notice: Contributes free funds to the contract.

claimProfit((address,uint256,uint256),by.notice: Withdraws the profit generated for the referral system. Only works if the notice is correct and the operator's signature is valid.

deposit().notice: Accepts the user's deposit and writes it to the user's account.

deposit(address).notice: Accepts the user's deposit and writes it to the user's account.

getUserNonce(address).notice: Get the user's nonce associated with their address.

withdraw(address,address,uint256,uint256.notice: Withdraws the deposit to the specified address, used exclusively by the operator.

withdrawBatch(address[],address[],uint25.notice: Batch withdraws the deposits to the specified addresses, used exclusively by the operator.
